You have a chessboard of size $n \times m$.  At time 0, all black squares are painted color 0.  

In each subsequent minute, the black squares that have exactly four corner-adjacent squares painted with the previous color are painted with the current color. This process continues forever.

Given an integer $x$, determine how many squares will be painted exactly $x$ times.

A grid of squares is repeatedly repainted.  At each minute, all squares that have exactly four adjacent squares of the previous color are repainted.  Find the number of squares that are repainted a specific number of times.
